2569  }
2570 
2573  inline void set(Configuration* conf) {
2574  if (conf == nullptr) {
2575  return;
2576  }
2577  set(conf->level(), conf->configurationType(), conf->value());
2578  }
2579 
2580  inline Configuration* get(Level level, ConfigurationType configurationType) {
2581  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2582  return RegistryWithPred<Configuration, Configuration::Predicate>::get(level, configurationType);
2583  }
2584 
2589  inline void setGlobally(ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value) {
2590  setGlobally(configurationType, value, false);
2591  }
2592 
2594  inline void clear(void) {
2595  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2596  unregisterAll();
2597  }
2598 
2602  inline const std::string& configurationFile(void) const {
2603  return m_configurationFile;
2604  }
2605 
2607  void setToDefault(void) {
2608  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Enabled, std::string("true"), true);
2609 #if !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
2610  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Filename, std::string(base::consts::kDefaultLogFile), true);
2611 #else
2612  ELPP_UNUSED(base::consts::kDefaultLogFile);
2613 #endif // !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
2614  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::ToFile, std::string("true"), true);
2615  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::ToStandardOutput, std::string("true"), true);
2616  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::MillisecondsWidth, std::string("3"), true);
2617  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::PerformanceTracking, std::string("true"), true);
2618  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::MaxLogFileSize, std::string("0"), true);
2619  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::LogFlushThreshold, std::string("0"), true);
2620 
2621  setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"), true);
2622  set(Level::Debug, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] [%user@%host] [%func] [%loc] %msg"));
2623  // INFO and WARNING are set to default by Level::Global
2624  set(Level::Error, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"));
2625  set(Level::Fatal, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"));
2626  set(Level::Verbose, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level-%vlevel [%logger] %msg"));
2627  set(Level::Trace, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] [%func] [%loc] %msg"));
2628  }
2629 
2637  void setRemainingToDefault(void) {
2638  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2639  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::Enabled, std::string("true"));
2640 #if !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
2641  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::Filename, std::string(base::consts::kDefaultLogFile));
2642 #endif // !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
2643  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::ToFile, std::string("true"));
2644  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::ToStandardOutput, std::string("true"));
2645  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::MillisecondsWidth, std::string("3"));
2646  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::PerformanceTracking, std::string("true"));
2647  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::MaxLogFileSize, std::string("0"));
2648  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"));
2649  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Debug, ConfigurationType::Format,
2650  std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] [%user@%host] [%func] [%loc] %msg"));
2651  // INFO and WARNING are set to default by Level::Global
2652  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Error, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"));
2653  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Fatal, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] %msg"));
2654  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Verbose, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level-%vlevel [%logger] %msg"));
2655  unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level::Trace, ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level [%logger] [%func] [%loc] %msg"));
2656  }
2657 
2662  class Parser : base::StaticClass {
2663  public:
2671  static bool parseFromFile(const std::string& configurationFile, Configurations* sender, Configurations* base = nullptr) {
2672  sender->setFromBase(base);
2673  std::ifstream fileStream_(configurationFile.c_str(), std::ifstream::in);
2674  ELPP_ASSERT(fileStream_.is_open(), "Unable to open configuration file [" << configurationFile << "] for parsing.");
2675  bool parsedSuccessfully = false;
2676  std::string line = std::string();
2677  Level currLevel = Level::Unknown;
2678  std::string currConfigStr = std::string();
2679  std::string currLevelStr = std::string();
2680  while (fileStream_.good()) {
2681  std::getline(fileStream_, line);
2682  parsedSuccessfully = parseLine(&line, &currConfigStr, &currLevelStr, &currLevel, sender);
2683  ELPP_ASSERT(parsedSuccessfully, "Unable to parse configuration line: " << line);
2684  }
2685  return parsedSuccessfully;
2686  }
2687 
2698  static bool parseFromText(const std::string& configurationsString, Configurations* sender, Configurations* base = nullptr) {
2699  sender->setFromBase(base);
2700  bool parsedSuccessfully = false;
2701  std::stringstream ss(configurationsString);
2702  std::string line = std::string();
2703  Level currLevel = Level::Unknown;
2704  std::string currConfigStr = std::string();
2705  std::string currLevelStr = std::string();
2706  while (std::getline(ss, line)) {
2707  parsedSuccessfully = parseLine(&line, &currConfigStr, &currLevelStr, &currLevel, sender);
2708  ELPP_ASSERT(parsedSuccessfully, "Unable to parse configuration line: " << line);
2709  }
2710  return parsedSuccessfully;
2711  }
2712 
2713  private:
2714  friend class el::Loggers;
2715  static void ignoreComments(std::string* line) {
2716  std::size_t foundAt = 0;
2717  std::size_t quotesStart = line->find("\"");
2718  std::size_t quotesEnd = std::string::npos;
2719  if (quotesStart != std::string::npos) {
2720  quotesEnd = line->find("\"", quotesStart + 1);
2721  while (quotesEnd != std::string::npos && line->at(quotesEnd - 1) == '\\') {
2722  // Do not erase slash yet - we will erase it in parseLine(..) while loop
2723  quotesEnd = line->find("\"", quotesEnd + 2);
2724  }
2725  }
2726  if ((foundAt = line->find(base::consts::kConfigurationComment)) != std::string::npos) {
2727  if (foundAt < quotesEnd) {
2728  foundAt = line->find(base::consts::kConfigurationComment, quotesEnd + 1);
2729  }
2730  *line = line->substr(0, foundAt);
2731  }
2732  }
2733  static inline bool isLevel(const std::string& line) {
2734  return base::utils::Str::startsWith(line, std::string(base::consts::kConfigurationLevel));
2735  }
2736 
2737  static inline bool isComment(const std::string& line) {
2738  return base::utils::Str::startsWith(line, std::string(base::consts::kConfigurationComment));
2739  }
2740 
2741  static inline bool isConfig(const std::string& line) {
2742  std::size_t assignment = line.find('=');
2743  return line != "" &&
2744  (line[0] >= 65 || line[0] <= 90 || line[0] >= 97 || line[0] <= 122) &&
2745  (assignment != std::string::npos) &&
2746  (line.size() > assignment);
2747  }
2748 
2749  static bool parseLine(std::string* line, std::string* currConfigStr, std::string* currLevelStr, Level* currLevel, Configurations* conf) {
2750  ConfigurationType currConfig = ConfigurationType::Unknown;
2751  std::string currValue = std::string();
2752  *line = base::utils::Str::trim(*line);
2753  if (isComment(*line)) return true;
2754  ignoreComments(line);
2755  *line = base::utils::Str::trim(*line);
2756  if (line->empty()) {
2757  // Comment ignored
2758  return true;
2759  }
2760  if (isLevel(*line)) {
2761  if (line->size() <= 2) {
2762  return true;
2763  }
2764  *currLevelStr = line->substr(1, line->size() - 2);
2765  *currLevelStr = base::utils::Str::toUpper(*currLevelStr);
2766  *currLevelStr = base::utils::Str::trim(*currLevelStr);
2767  *currLevel = LevelHelper::convertFromString(currLevelStr->c_str());
2768  return true;
2769  }
2770  if (isConfig(*line)) {
2771  std::size_t assignment = line->find('=');
2772  *currConfigStr = line->substr(0, assignment);
2773  *currConfigStr = base::utils::Str::toUpper(*currConfigStr);
2774  *currConfigStr = base::utils::Str::trim(*currConfigStr);
2775  currConfig = ConfigurationTypeHelper::convertFromString(currConfigStr->c_str());
2776  currValue = line->substr(assignment + 1);
2777  currValue = base::utils::Str::trim(currValue);
2778  std::size_t quotesStart = currValue.find("\"", 0);
2779  std::size_t quotesEnd = std::string::npos;
2780  if (quotesStart != std::string::npos) {
2781  quotesEnd = currValue.find("\"", quotesStart + 1);
2782  while (quotesEnd != std::string::npos && currValue.at(quotesEnd - 1) == '\\') {
2783  currValue = currValue.erase(quotesEnd - 1, 1);
2784  quotesEnd = currValue.find("\"", quotesEnd + 2);
2785  }
2786  }
2787  if (quotesStart != std::string::npos && quotesEnd != std::string::npos) {
2788  // Quote provided - check and strip if valid
2789  ELPP_ASSERT((quotesStart < quotesEnd), "Configuration error - No ending quote found in ["
2790  << currConfigStr << "]");
2791  ELPP_ASSERT((quotesStart + 1 != quotesEnd), "Empty configuration value for [" << currConfigStr << "]");
2792  if ((quotesStart != quotesEnd) && (quotesStart + 1 != quotesEnd)) {
2793  // Explicit check in case if assertion is disabled
2794  currValue = currValue.substr(quotesStart + 1, quotesEnd - 1);
2795  }
2796  }
2797  }
2798  ELPP_ASSERT(*currLevel != Level::Unknown, "Unrecognized severity level [" << *currLevelStr << "]");
2799  ELPP_ASSERT(currConfig != ConfigurationType::Unknown, "Unrecognized configuration [" << *currConfigStr << "]");
2800  if (*currLevel == Level::Unknown || currConfig == ConfigurationType::Unknown) {
2801  return false; // unrecognizable level or config
2802  }
2803  conf->set(*currLevel, currConfig, currValue);
2804  return true;
2805  }
2806  };
2807 
2808 private:
2809  std::string m_configurationFile;
2810  bool m_isFromFile;
2811  friend class el::Loggers;
2812 
2814  void unsafeSetIfNotExist(Level level, ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value) {
2815  Configuration* conf = RegistryWithPred<Configuration, Configuration::Predicate>::get(level, configurationType);
2816  if (conf == nullptr) {
2817  unsafeSet(level, configurationType, value);
2818  }
2819  }
2820 
2822  void unsafeSet(Level level, ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value) {
2823  Configuration* conf = RegistryWithPred<Configuration, Configuration::Predicate>::get(level, configurationType);
2824  if (conf == nullptr) {
2825  registerNew(new Configuration(level, configurationType, value));
2826  } else {
2827  conf->setValue(value);
2828  }
2829  if (level == Level::Global) {
2830  unsafeSetGlobally(configurationType, value, false);
2831  }
2832  }
2833 
2836  void setGlobally(ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value, bool includeGlobalLevel) {
2837  if (includeGlobalLevel) {
2838  set(Level::Global, configurationType, value);
2839  }
2840  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
2841  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
2842  set(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex), configurationType, value);
2843  return false; // Do not break lambda function yet as we need to set all levels regardless
2844  });
2845  }
2846 
2849  void unsafeSetGlobally(ConfigurationType configurationType, const std::string& value, bool includeGlobalLevel) {
2850  if (includeGlobalLevel) {
2851  unsafeSet(Level::Global, configurationType, value);
2852  }
2853  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
2854  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
2855  unsafeSet(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex), configurationType, value);
2856  return false; // Do not break lambda function yet as we need to set all levels regardless
2857  });
2858  }
2859 };
2860 
2861 namespace base {
2862 typedef std::shared_ptr<base::type::fstream_t> FileStreamPtr;
2863 typedef std::map<std::string, FileStreamPtr> LogStreamsReferenceMap;
2870 class TypedConfigurations : public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
2871 public:
2875  TypedConfigurations(Configurations* configurations, base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* logStreamsReference) {
2876  m_configurations = configurations;
2877  m_logStreamsReference = logStreamsReference;
2878  build(m_configurations);
2879  }
2880 
2881  TypedConfigurations(const TypedConfigurations& other) {
2882  this->m_configurations = other.m_configurations;
2883  this->m_logStreamsReference = other.m_logStreamsReference;
2884  build(m_configurations);
2885  }
2886 
2887  virtual ~TypedConfigurations(void) {
2888  }
2889 
2890  const Configurations* configurations(void) const {
2891  return m_configurations;
2892  }
2893 
2894  inline bool enabled(Level level) {
2895  return getConfigByVal<bool>(level, &m_enabledMap, "enabled");
2896  }
2897 
2898  inline bool toFile(Level level) {
2899  return getConfigByVal<bool>(level, &m_toFileMap, "toFile");
2900  }
2901 
2902  inline const std::string& filename(Level level) {
2903  return getConfigByRef<std::string>(level, &m_filenameMap, "filename");
2904  }
2905 
2906  inline bool toStandardOutput(Level level) {
2907  return getConfigByVal<bool>(level, &m_toStandardOutputMap, "toStandardOutput");
2908  }
2909 
2910  inline const base::LogFormat& logFormat(Level level) {
2911  return getConfigByRef<base::LogFormat>(level, &m_logFormatMap, "logFormat");
2912  }
2913 
2914  inline const base::MillisecondsWidth& millisecondsWidth(Level level = Level::Global) {
2915  return getConfigByRef<base::MillisecondsWidth>(level, &m_millisecondsWidthMap, "millisecondsWidth");
2916  }
2917 
2918  inline bool performanceTracking(Level level = Level::Global) {
2919  return getConfigByVal<bool>(level, &m_performanceTrackingMap, "performanceTracking");
2920  }
2921 
2922  inline base::type::fstream_t* fileStream(Level level) {
2923  return getConfigByRef<base::FileStreamPtr>(level, &m_fileStreamMap, "fileStream").get();
2924  }
2925 
2926  inline std::size_t maxLogFileSize(Level level) {
2927  return getConfigByVal<std::size_t>(level, &m_maxLogFileSizeMap, "maxLogFileSize");
2928  }
2929 
2930  inline std::size_t logFlushThreshold(Level level) {
2931  return getConfigByVal<std::size_t>(level, &m_logFlushThresholdMap, "logFlushThreshold");
2932  }
2933 
2934 private:
2935  Configurations* m_configurations;
2936  std::map<Level, bool> m_enabledMap;
2937  std::map<Level, bool> m_toFileMap;
2938  std::map<Level, std::string> m_filenameMap;
2939  std::map<Level, bool> m_toStandardOutputMap;
2940  std::map<Level, base::LogFormat> m_logFormatMap;
2941  std::map<Level, base::MillisecondsWidth> m_millisecondsWidthMap;
2942  std::map<Level, bool> m_performanceTrackingMap;
2943  std::map<Level, base::FileStreamPtr> m_fileStreamMap;
2944  std::map<Level, std::size_t> m_maxLogFileSizeMap;
2945  std::map<Level, std::size_t> m_logFlushThresholdMap;
2946  base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* m_logStreamsReference;
2947  std::map<Level, std::string> m_fileFullnameMap; // add to record file base name in config
2948  std::map<Level, std::size_t> m_fileLastTimeMap; // add to record last time, for changing file name
2949 
2950  friend class el::Helpers;
2951  friend class el::base::MessageBuilder;
2952  friend class el::base::Writer;
2953  friend class el::base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback;
2954  friend class el::base::LogDispatcher;
2955 
2956  template <typename Conf_T>
2957  inline Conf_T getConfigByVal(Level level, const std::map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
2958  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2959  return unsafeGetConfigByVal(level, confMap, confName); // This is not unsafe anymore - mutex locked in scope
2960  }
2961 
2962  template <typename Conf_T>
2963  inline Conf_T& getConfigByRef(Level level, std::map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
2964  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
2965  return unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, confMap, confName); // This is not unsafe anymore - mutex locked in scope
2966  }
2967 
2968  template <typename Conf_T>
2969  inline Conf_T unsafeGetConfigByVal(Level level, const std::map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
2970  ELPP_UNUSED(confName);
2971  typename std::map<Level, Conf_T>::const_iterator it = confMap->find(level);
2972  if (it == confMap->end()) {
2973  try {
2974  return confMap->at(Level::Global);
2975  } catch (...) {
2976  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unable to get configuration [" << confName << "] for level ["
2977  << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "]"
2978  << std::endl << "Please ensure you have properly configured logger.", false);
2979  return Conf_T();
2980  }
2981  }
2982  return it->second;
2983  }
2984 
2985  template <typename Conf_T>
2986  inline Conf_T& unsafeGetConfigByRef(Level level, std::map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, const char* confName) {
2987  ELPP_UNUSED(confName);
2988  typename std::map<Level, Conf_T>::iterator it = confMap->find(level);
2989  if (it == confMap->end()) {
2990  try {
2991  return confMap->at(Level::Global);
2992  } catch (...) {
2993  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unable to get configuration [" << confName << "] for level ["
2994  << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "]"
2995  << std::endl << "Please ensure you have properly configured logger.", false);
2996  }
2997  }
2998  return it->second;
2999  }
3000 
3001  template <typename Conf_T>
3002  void setValue(Level level, const Conf_T& value, std::map<Level, Conf_T>* confMap, bool includeGlobalLevel = true) {
3003  // If map is empty and we are allowed to add into generic level (Level::Global), do it!
3004  if (confMap->empty() && includeGlobalLevel) {
3005  confMap->insert(std::make_pair(Level::Global, value));
3006  return;
3007  }
3008  // If same value exist in generic level already, dont add it to explicit level
3009  typename std::map<Level, Conf_T>::iterator it = confMap->find(Level::Global);
3010  if (it != confMap->end() && it->second == value) {
3011  return;
3012  }
3013  // Now make sure we dont double up values if we really need to add it to explicit level
3014  it = confMap->find(level);
3015  if (it == confMap->end()) {
3016  // Value not found for level, add new
3017  confMap->insert(std::make_pair(level, value));
3018  } else {
3019  // Value found, just update value
3020  confMap->at(level) = value;
3021  }
3022  }
3023 
3024  void build(Configurations* configurations) {
3025  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3026  auto getBool = [] (std::string boolStr) -> bool { // Pass by value for trimming
3027  base::utils::Str::trim(boolStr);
3028  return (boolStr == "TRUE" || boolStr == "true" || boolStr == "1");
3029  };
3030  std::vector<Configuration*> withFileSizeLimit;
3031  for (Configurations::const_iterator it = configurations->begin(); it != configurations->end(); ++it) {
3032  Configuration* conf = *it;
3033  // We cannot use switch on strong enums because Intel C++ dont support them yet
3034  if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::Enabled) {
3035  setValue(conf->level(), getBool(conf->value()), &m_enabledMap);
3036  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::ToFile) {
3037  setValue(conf->level(), getBool(conf->value()), &m_toFileMap);
3038  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::ToStandardOutput) {
3039  setValue(conf->level(), getBool(conf->value()), &m_toStandardOutputMap);
3040  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::Filename) {
3041  // We do not yet configure filename but we will configure in another
3042  // loop. This is because if file cannot be created, we will force ToFile
3043  // to be false. Because configuring logger is not necessarily performance
3044  // sensative operation, we can live with another loop; (by the way this loop
3045  // is not very heavy either)
3046  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::Format) {
3047  setValue(conf->level(), base::LogFormat(conf->level(),
3048  base::type::string_t(conf->value().begin(), conf->value().end())), &m_logFormatMap);
3049  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::MillisecondsWidth) {
3050  setValue(Level::Global,
3051  base::MillisecondsWidth(static_cast<int>(getULong(conf->value()))), &m_millisecondsWidthMap);
3052  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::PerformanceTracking) {
3053  setValue(Level::Global, getBool(conf->value()), &m_performanceTrackingMap);
3054  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::MaxLogFileSize) {
3055  setValue(conf->level(), static_cast<std::size_t>(getULong(conf->value())), &m_maxLogFileSizeMap);
3056 #if !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
3057  withFileSizeLimit.push_back(conf);
3058 #endif // !defined(ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE)
3059  } else if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::LogFlushThreshold) {
3060  setValue(conf->level(), static_cast<std::size_t>(getULong(conf->value())), &m_logFlushThresholdMap);
3061  }
3062  }
3063  // As mentioned early, we will now set filename configuration in separate loop to deal with non-existent files
3064  for (Configurations::const_iterator it = configurations->begin(); it != configurations->end(); ++it) {
3065  Configuration* conf = *it;
3066  if (conf->configurationType() == ConfigurationType::Filename) {
3067  insertFile(conf->level(), conf->value());
3068  }
3069  }
3070  for (std::vector<Configuration*>::iterator conf = withFileSizeLimit.begin();
3071  conf != withFileSizeLimit.end(); ++conf) {
3072  // This is not unsafe as mutex is locked in currect scope
3073  unsafeValidateFileRolling((*conf)->level(), base::defaultPreRollOutCallback);
3074  }
3075  }
3076 
3077  unsigned long getULong(std::string confVal) {
3078  bool valid = true;
3079  base::utils::Str::trim(confVal);
3080  valid = !confVal.empty() && std::find_if(confVal.begin(), confVal.end(),
3081  [](char c) { return !base::utils::Str::isDigit(c); }) == confVal.end();
3082  if (!valid) {
3083  valid = false;
3084  ELPP_ASSERT(valid, "Configuration value not a valid integer [" << confVal << "]");
3085  return 0;
3086  }
3087  return atol(confVal.c_str());
3088  }
3089 
3090  std::string resolveFilename(const std::string& filename) {
3091  std::string resultingFilename = filename;
3092  std::size_t dateIndex = std::string::npos;
3093  std::string dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr = std::string(base::consts::kDateTimeFormatSpecifierForFilename);
3094  if ((dateIndex = resultingFilename.find(dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr.c_str())) != std::string::npos) {
3095  while (dateIndex > 0 && resultingFilename[dateIndex - 1] == base::consts::kFormatSpecifierChar) {
3096  dateIndex = resultingFilename.find(dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr.c_str(), dateIndex + 1);
3097  }
3098  if (dateIndex != std::string::npos) {
3099  const char* ptr = resultingFilename.c_str() + dateIndex;
3100  // Goto end of specifier
3101  ptr += dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr.size();
3102  std::string fmt;
3103  if ((resultingFilename.size() > dateIndex) && (ptr[0] == '{')) {
3104  // User has provided format for date/time
3105  ++ptr;
3106  int count = 1; // Start by 1 in order to remove starting brace
3107  std::stringstream ss;
3108  for (; *ptr; ++ptr, ++count) {
3109  if (*ptr == '}') {
3110  ++count; // In order to remove ending brace
3111  break;
3112  }
3113  ss << *ptr;
3114  }
3115  resultingFilename.erase(dateIndex + dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr.size(), count);
3116  fmt = ss.str();
3117  } else {
3118  fmt = std::string(base::consts::kDefaultDateTimeFormatInFilename);
3119  }
3120  base::MillisecondsWidth msWidth(3);
3121  std::string now = base::utils::DateTime::getDateTime(fmt.c_str(), &msWidth);
3122  base::utils::Str::replaceAll(now, '/', '-'); // Replace path element since we are dealing with filename
3123  base::utils::Str::replaceAll(resultingFilename, dateTimeFormatSpecifierStr, now);
3124  }
3125  }
3126  return resultingFilename;
3127  }
3128 
3129  void insertFile(Level level, const std::string& fullFilename) {
3130  std::string resolvedFilename = resolveFilename(fullFilename);
3131  if (resolvedFilename.empty()) {
3132  std::cerr << "Could not load empty file for logging, please re-check your configurations for level ["
3133  << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "]";
3134  }
3135  std::string filePath = base::utils::File::extractPathFromFilename(resolvedFilename, base::consts::kFilePathSeperator);
3136  if (filePath.size() < resolvedFilename.size()) {
3137  base::utils::File::createPath(filePath);
3138  }
3139  auto create = [&](Level level) {
3140  base::LogStreamsReferenceMap::iterator filestreamIter = m_logStreamsReference->find(resolvedFilename);
3141  base::type::fstream_t* fs = nullptr;
3142  if (filestreamIter == m_logStreamsReference->end()) {
3143  // We need a completely new stream, nothing to share with
3144  fs = base::utils::File::newFileStream(resolvedFilename);
3145  m_filenameMap.insert(std::make_pair(level, resolvedFilename));
3146  m_fileStreamMap.insert(std::make_pair(level, base::FileStreamPtr(fs)));
3147  m_logStreamsReference->insert(std::make_pair(resolvedFilename, base::FileStreamPtr(m_fileStreamMap.at(level))));
3148  } else {
3149  // Woops! we have an existing one, share it!
3150  m_filenameMap.insert(std::make_pair(level, filestreamIter->first));
3151  m_fileStreamMap.insert(std::make_pair(level, base::FileStreamPtr(filestreamIter->second)));
3152  fs = filestreamIter->second.get();
3153  }
3154  if (fs == nullptr) {
3155  // We display bad file error from newFileStream()
3156  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Setting [TO_FILE] of ["
3157  << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "] to FALSE", false);
3158  setValue(level, false, &m_toFileMap);
3159  }
3160  };
3161  // If we dont have file conf for any level, create it for Level::Global first
3162  // otherwise create for specified level
3163  create(m_filenameMap.empty() && m_fileStreamMap.empty() ? Level::Global : level);
3164 
3165  struct ::tm timeinfo = base::utils::DateTime::getCurrentTm();
3166  m_fileFullnameMap[level] = fullFilename;
3167  m_fileLastTimeMap[level] = timeinfo.tm_hour;
3168  }
3169 
3170  bool unsafeValidateFileRolling(Level level, const PreRollOutCallback& PreRollOutCallback) {
3171  base::type::fstream_t* fs = unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, &m_fileStreamMap, "fileStream").get();
3172  if (fs == nullptr) {
3173  return true;
3174  }
3175  std::size_t maxLogFileSize = unsafeGetConfigByVal(level, &m_maxLogFileSizeMap, "maxLogFileSize");
3176  /*std::size_t*/ int64_t currFileSize = base::utils::File::getSizeOfFile(fs);
3177  if (maxLogFileSize != 0 && currFileSize >= (int64_t)maxLogFileSize) {
3178  std::string fname = unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, &m_filenameMap, "filename");
3179  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(1, "Truncating log file [" << fname << "] as a result of configurations for level ["
3180  << LevelHelper::convertToString(level) << "]");
3181  fs->close();
3182  PreRollOutCallback(fname.c_str(), currFileSize);
3183  fs->open(fname, std::fstream::out | std::fstream::trunc);
3184  return true;
3185  }
3186 
3187  struct ::tm timeinfo = base::utils::DateTime::getCurrentTm();
3188  std::size_t lastRollingHour = unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, &m_fileLastTimeMap, "lastRollingTime");
3189  if (lastRollingHour != timeinfo.tm_hour)
3190  {
3200 
3204 
3205  std::string fname = unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, &m_filenameMap, "filename");
3206  fs->close();
3207  //base::utils::safeDelete(fs);
3208  m_fileStreamMap.erase(level);
3209  m_filenameMap.erase(level);
3210  m_logStreamsReference->erase(fname);
3211  //PreRollOutCallback(fname.c_str(), currFileSize);
3212  std::string& fileFullname = unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, &m_fileFullnameMap, "fileFullName");
3213  insertFile(level, fileFullname);
3214  return true;
3215 
3217  //fname = unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, &m_filenameMap, "filename");
3218  //base::type::fstream_t* new_fs = unsafeGetConfigByRef(level, &m_fileStreamMap, "fileStream").get();
3219  //if (new_fs == nullptr) {
3220  // return true;
3221  //}
3222 
3223  //if (new_fs->is_open())
3224  //{
3225  // // just check
3226  // return true;
3227  //}
3228 
3229  //new_fs->open(fname, std::fstream::out | std::fstream::trunc);
3230  //return true;
3231  }
3232 
3233  return false;
3234  }
3235 
3236  bool validateFileRolling(Level level, const PreRollOutCallback& PreRollOutCallback) {
3237  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3238  return unsafeValidateFileRolling(level, PreRollOutCallback);
3239  }
3240 };
3242 class HitCounter {
3243 public:
3244  HitCounter(void) :
3245  m_filename(""),
3246  m_lineNumber(0),
3247  m_hitCounts(0) {
3248  }
3249 
3250  HitCounter(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber) :
3251  m_filename(filename),
3252  m_lineNumber(lineNumber),
3253  m_hitCounts(0) {
3254  }
3255 
3256  HitCounter(const HitCounter& hitCounter) :
3257  m_filename(hitCounter.m_filename),
3258  m_lineNumber(hitCounter.m_lineNumber),
3259  m_hitCounts(hitCounter.m_hitCounts) {
3260  }
3261 
3262  HitCounter& operator=(const HitCounter& hitCounter) {
3263  m_filename = hitCounter.m_filename;
3264  m_lineNumber = hitCounter.m_lineNumber;
3265  m_hitCounts = hitCounter.m_hitCounts;
3266  return *this;
3267  }
3268 
3269  virtual ~HitCounter(void) {
3270  }
3271 
3273  inline void resetLocation(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber) {
3274  m_filename = filename;
3275  m_lineNumber = lineNumber;
3276  }
3277 
3279  inline void validateHitCounts(std::size_t n) {
3280  if (m_hitCounts >= base::consts::kMaxLogPerCounter) {
3281  m_hitCounts = (n >= 1 ? base::consts::kMaxLogPerCounter % n : 0);
3282  }
3283  ++m_hitCounts;
3284  }
3285 
3286  inline const char* filename(void) const {
3287  return m_filename;
3288  }
3289 
3290  inline unsigned long int lineNumber(void) const {
3291  return m_lineNumber;
3292  }
3293 
3294  inline std::size_t hitCounts(void) const {
3295  return m_hitCounts;
3296  }
3297 
3298  inline void increment(void) {
3299  ++m_hitCounts;
3300  }
3301 
3302  class Predicate {
3303  public:
3304  Predicate(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber)
3305  : m_filename(filename),
3306  m_lineNumber(lineNumber) {
3307  }
3308  inline bool operator()(const HitCounter* counter) {
3309  return ((counter != nullptr) &&
3310  (strcmp(counter->m_filename, m_filename) == 0) &&
3311  (counter->m_lineNumber == m_lineNumber));
3312  }
3313 
3314  private:
3315  const char* m_filename;
3316  unsigned long int m_lineNumber;
3317  };
3318 
3319 private:
3320  const char* m_filename;
3321  unsigned long int m_lineNumber;
3322  std::size_t m_hitCounts;
3323 };
3325 class RegisteredHitCounters : public base::utils::RegistryWithPred<base::HitCounter, base::HitCounter::Predicate> {
3326 public:
3329  bool validateEveryN(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t n) {
3330  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3331  base::HitCounter* counter = get(filename, lineNumber);
3332  if (counter == nullptr) {
3333  registerNew(counter = new base::HitCounter(filename, lineNumber));
3334  }
3335  counter->validateHitCounts(n);
3336  bool result = (n >= 1 && counter->hitCounts() != 0 && counter->hitCounts() % n == 0);
3337  return result;
3338  }
3339 
3342  bool validateAfterN(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t n) {
3343  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3344  base::HitCounter* counter = get(filename, lineNumber);
3345  if (counter == nullptr) {
3346  registerNew(counter = new base::HitCounter(filename, lineNumber));
3347  }
3348  // Do not use validateHitCounts here since we do not want to reset counter here
3349  // Note the >= instead of > because we are incrementing
3350  // after this check
3351  if (counter->hitCounts() >= n)
3352  return true;
3353  counter->increment();
3354  return false;
3355  }
3356 
3359  bool validateNTimes(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t n) {
3360  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3361  base::HitCounter* counter = get(filename, lineNumber);
3362  if (counter == nullptr) {
3363  registerNew(counter = new base::HitCounter(filename, lineNumber));
3364  }
3365  counter->increment();
3366  // Do not use validateHitCounts here since we do not want to reset counter here
3367  if (counter->hitCounts() <= n)
3368  return true;
3369  return false;
3370  }
3371 
3373  inline const base::HitCounter* getCounter(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber) {
3374  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3375  return get(filename, lineNumber);
3376  }
3377 };
3379 enum class DispatchAction : base::type::EnumType {
3380  None = 1, NormalLog = 2, SysLog = 4
3381 };
3382 } // namespace base
3383 template <typename T>
3384 class Callback : protected base::threading::ThreadSafe {
3385 public:
3386  Callback(void) : m_enabled(true) {}
3387  inline bool enabled(void) const { return m_enabled; }
3388  inline void setEnabled(bool enabled) {
3389  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3390  m_enabled = enabled;
3391  }
3392 protected:
3393  virtual void handle(const T* handlePtr) = 0;
3394 private:
3395  bool m_enabled;
3396 };
3397 class LogDispatchData {
3398 public:
3399  LogDispatchData() : m_logMessage(nullptr), m_dispatchAction(base::DispatchAction::None) {}
3400  inline const LogMessage* logMessage(void) const { return m_logMessage; }
3401  inline base::DispatchAction dispatchAction(void) const { return m_dispatchAction; }
3402 private:
3403  LogMessage* m_logMessage;
3404  base::DispatchAction m_dispatchAction;
3405  friend class base::LogDispatcher;
3406 
3407  inline void setLogMessage(LogMessage* logMessage) { m_logMessage = logMessage; }
3408  inline void setDispatchAction(base::DispatchAction dispatchAction) { m_dispatchAction = dispatchAction; }
3409 };
3410 class LogDispatchCallback : public Callback<LogDispatchData> {
3411 private:
3412  friend class base::LogDispatcher;
3413 };
3414 class PerformanceTrackingCallback : public Callback<PerformanceTrackingData> {
3415 private:
3416  friend class base::PerformanceTracker;
3417 };
3418 class LogBuilder : base::NoCopy {
3419 public:
3420  virtual ~LogBuilder(void) { ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(3, "Destroying log builder...")}
3421  virtual base::type::string_t build(const LogMessage* logMessage, bool appendNewLine) const = 0;
3422  void convertToColoredOutput(base::type::string_t* logLine, Level level) {
3423  if (!base::utils::s_termSupportsColor) return;
3424  const base::type::char_t* resetColor = ELPP_LITERAL("\x1b[0m");
3425  if (level == Level::Error || level == Level::Fatal)
3426  *logLine = ELPP_LITERAL("\x1b[31m") + *logLine + resetColor;
3427  else if (level == Level::Warning)
3428  *logLine = ELPP_LITERAL("\x1b[33m") + *logLine + resetColor;
3429  }
3430 private:
3431  friend class el::base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback;
3432 };
3433 typedef std::shared_ptr<LogBuilder> LogBuilderPtr;
3437 class Logger : public base::threading::ThreadSafe, public Loggable {
3438 public:
3439  Logger(const std::string& id, base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* logStreamsReference) :
3440  m_id(id),
3441  m_typedConfigurations(nullptr),
3442  m_parentApplicationName(std::string()),
3443  m_isConfigured(false),
3444  m_logStreamsReference(logStreamsReference) {
3445  initUnflushedCount();
3446  }
3447 
3448  Logger(const std::string& id, const Configurations& configurations, base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* logStreamsReference) :
3449  m_id(id),
3450  m_typedConfigurations(nullptr),
3451  m_parentApplicationName(std::string()),
3452  m_isConfigured(false),
3453  m_logStreamsReference(logStreamsReference) {
3454  initUnflushedCount();
3455  configure(configurations);
3456  }
3457 
3458  Logger(const Logger& logger) {
3459  base::utils::safeDelete(m_typedConfigurations);
3460  m_id = logger.m_id;
3461  m_typedConfigurations = logger.m_typedConfigurations;
3462  m_parentApplicationName = logger.m_parentApplicationName;
3463  m_isConfigured = logger.m_isConfigured;
3464  m_configurations = logger.m_configurations;
3465  m_unflushedCount = logger.m_unflushedCount;
3466  m_logStreamsReference = logger.m_logStreamsReference;
3467  }
3468 
3469  Logger& operator=(const Logger& logger) {
3470  base::utils::safeDelete(m_typedConfigurations);
3471  m_id = logger.m_id;
3472  m_typedConfigurations = logger.m_typedConfigurations;
3473  m_parentApplicationName = logger.m_parentApplicationName;
3474  m_isConfigured = logger.m_isConfigured;
3475  m_configurations = logger.m_configurations;
3476  m_unflushedCount = logger.m_unflushedCount;
3477  m_logStreamsReference = logger.m_logStreamsReference;
3478  return *this;
3479  }
3480 
3481  virtual ~Logger(void) {
3482  base::utils::safeDelete(m_typedConfigurations);
3483  }
3484 
3485  virtual inline void log(el::base::type::ostream_t& os) const {
3486  os << m_id.c_str();
3487  }
3488 
3490  void configure(const Configurations& configurations) {
3491  m_isConfigured = false; // we set it to false in case if we fail
3492  initUnflushedCount();
3493  if (m_typedConfigurations != nullptr) {
3494  Configurations* c = const_cast<Configurations*>(m_typedConfigurations->configurations());
3495  if (c->hasConfiguration(Level::Global, ConfigurationType::Filename)) {
3496  // This check is definitely needed for cases like ELPP_NO_DEFAULT_LOG_FILE
3497  flush();
3498  }
3499  }
3500  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3501  if (m_configurations != configurations) {
3502  m_configurations.setFromBase(const_cast<Configurations*>(&configurations));
3503  }
3504  base::utils::safeDelete(m_typedConfigurations);
3505  m_typedConfigurations = new base::TypedConfigurations(&m_configurations, m_logStreamsReference);
3506  resolveLoggerFormatSpec();
3507  m_isConfigured = true;
3508  }
3509 
3511  inline void reconfigure(void) {
3512  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(1, "Reconfiguring logger [" << m_id << "]");
3513  configure(m_configurations);
3514  }
3515 
3516  inline const std::string& id(void) const {
3517  return m_id;
3518  }
3519 
3520  inline const std::string& parentApplicationName(void) const {
3521  return m_parentApplicationName;
3522  }
3523 
3524  inline void setParentApplicationName(const std::string& parentApplicationName) {
3525  m_parentApplicationName = parentApplicationName;
3526  }
3527 
3528  inline Configurations* configurations(void) {
3529  return &m_configurations;
3530  }
3531 
3532  inline base::TypedConfigurations* typedConfigurations(void) {
3533  return m_typedConfigurations;
3534  }
3535 
3536  static inline bool isValidId(const std::string& id) {
3537  for (std::string::const_iterator it = id.begin(); it != id.end(); ++it) {
3538  if (!base::utils::Str::contains(base::consts::kValidLoggerIdSymbols, *it)) {
3539  return false;
3540  }
3541  }
3542  return true;
3543  }
3545  inline void flush(void) {
3546  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(3, "Flushing logger [" << m_id << "] all levels");
3547  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3548  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
3549  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
3550  flush(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex), nullptr);
3551  return false;
3552  });
3553  }
3554 
3555  inline void flush(Level level, base::type::fstream_t* fs) {
3556  if (fs == nullptr && m_typedConfigurations->toFile(level)) {
3557  fs = m_typedConfigurations->fileStream(level);
3558  }
3559  if (fs != nullptr) {
3560  fs->flush();
3561  m_unflushedCount.find(level)->second = 0;
3562  }
3563  }
3564 
3565  inline bool isFlushNeeded(Level level) {
3566  return ++m_unflushedCount.find(level)->second >= m_typedConfigurations->logFlushThreshold(level);
3567  }
3568 
3569  inline LogBuilder* logBuilder(void) const {
3570  return m_logBuilder.get();
3571  }
3572 
3573  inline void setLogBuilder(const LogBuilderPtr& logBuilder) {
3574  m_logBuilder = logBuilder;
3575  }
3576 
3577  inline bool enabled(Level level) const {
3578  return m_typedConfigurations->enabled(level);
3579  }
3580 
3581 #if ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED
3582 # define LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(FUNCTION_NAME)\
3583  template <typename T, typename... Args>\
3584  inline void FUNCTION_NAME(const char*, const T&, const Args&...);\
3585  template <typename T>\
3586  inline void FUNCTION_NAME(const T&);
3587 
3588  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3589  inline void verbose(int, const char*, const T&, const Args&...);
3590 
3591  template <typename T>
3592  inline void verbose(int, const T&);
3593 
3594  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(info)
3595  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(debug)
3596  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(warn)
3597  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(error)
3598  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(fatal)
3599  LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES(trace)
3600 # undef LOGGER_LEVEL_WRITERS_SIGNATURES
3601 #endif // ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED
3602 private:
3603  std::string m_id;
3604  base::TypedConfigurations* m_typedConfigurations;
3605  base::type::stringstream_t m_stream;
3606  std::string m_parentApplicationName;
3607  bool m_isConfigured;
3608  Configurations m_configurations;
3609  std::map<Level, unsigned int> m_unflushedCount;
3610  base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* m_logStreamsReference;
3611  LogBuilderPtr m_logBuilder;

3618  friend class el::base::MessageBuilder;

3620  friend class el::base::PErrorWriter;

3627 #if ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED
3628  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3629  void log_(Level, int, const char*, const T&, const Args&...);
3630 
3631  template <typename T>
3632  inline void log_(Level, int, const T&);
3633 
3634  template <typename T, typename... Args>
3635  void log(Level, const char*, const T&, const Args&...);
3636 
3637  template <typename T>
3638  inline void log(Level, const T&);
3639 #endif // ELPP_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES_SUPPORTED
3640 
3641  void initUnflushedCount(void) {
3642  m_unflushedCount.clear();
3643  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
3644  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
3645  m_unflushedCount.insert(std::make_pair(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex), 0));
3646  return false;
3647  });
3648  }
3649 
3650  inline base::type::stringstream_t& stream(void) {
3651  return m_stream;
3652  }
3653 
3654  void resolveLoggerFormatSpec(void) const {
3655  base::type::EnumType lIndex = LevelHelper::kMinValid;
3656  LevelHelper::forEachLevel(&lIndex, [&](void) -> bool {
3657  base::LogFormat* logFormat =
3658  const_cast<base::LogFormat*>(&m_typedConfigurations->logFormat(LevelHelper::castFromInt(lIndex)));
3659  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logFormat->m_format, base::consts::kLoggerIdFormatSpecifier, m_id);
3660  return false;
3661  });
3662  }
3663 };
3664 namespace base {
3666 class RegisteredLoggers : public base::utils::Registry<Logger, std::string> {
3667 public:
3668  explicit RegisteredLoggers(const LogBuilderPtr& defaultLogBuilder) :
3669  m_defaultLogBuilder(defaultLogBuilder) {
3670  m_defaultConfigurations.setToDefault();
3671  }
3672 
3673  virtual ~RegisteredLoggers(void) {
3674  flushAll();
3675  }
3676 
3677  inline void setDefaultConfigurations(const Configurations& configurations) {
3678  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3679  m_defaultConfigurations.setFromBase(const_cast<Configurations*>(&configurations));
3680  }
3681 
3682  inline Configurations* defaultConfigurations(void) {
3683  return &m_defaultConfigurations;
3684  }
3685 
3686  Logger* get(const std::string& id, bool forceCreation = true) {
3687  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3688  Logger* logger_ = base::utils::Registry<Logger, std::string>::get(id);
3689  if (logger_ == nullptr && forceCreation) {
3690  bool validId = Logger::isValidId(id);
3691  if (!validId) {
3692  ELPP_ASSERT(validId, "Invalid logger ID [" << id << "]. Not registering this logger.");
3693  return nullptr;
3694  }
3695  logger_ = new Logger(id, m_defaultConfigurations, &m_logStreamsReference);
3696  logger_->m_logBuilder = m_defaultLogBuilder;
3697  registerNew(id, logger_);
3698  }
3699  return logger_;
3700  }
3701 
3702  bool remove(const std::string& id) {
3703  if (id == "default") {
3704  return false;
3705  }
3706  Logger* logger = base::utils::Registry<Logger, std::string>::get(id);
3707  if (logger != nullptr) {
3708  unregister(logger);
3709  }
3710  return true;
3711  }
3712 
3713  inline bool has(const std::string& id) {
3714  return get(id, false) != nullptr;
3715  }
3716 
3717  inline void unregister(Logger*& logger) {
3718  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3719  base::utils::Registry<Logger, std::string>::unregister(logger->id());
3720  }
3721 
3722  inline base::LogStreamsReferenceMap* logStreamsReference(void) {
3723  return &m_logStreamsReference;
3724  }
3725 
3726  inline void flushAll(void) {
3727  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(1, "Flushing all log files");
3728  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3729  for (base::LogStreamsReferenceMap::iterator it = m_logStreamsReference.begin();
3730  it != m_logStreamsReference.end(); ++it) {
3731  if (it->second.get() == nullptr) continue;
3732  it->second->flush();
3733  }
3734  }
3735 
3736 private:
3737  LogBuilderPtr m_defaultLogBuilder;
3738  Configurations m_defaultConfigurations;
3739  base::LogStreamsReferenceMap m_logStreamsReference;
3740  friend class el::base::Storage;
3741 };
3743 class VRegistry : base::NoCopy, public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
3744 public:
3745  explicit VRegistry(base::type::VerboseLevel level, base::type::EnumType* pFlags) : m_level(level), m_pFlags(pFlags) {
3746  }
3747 
3749  inline void setLevel(base::type::VerboseLevel level) {
3750  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3751  if (level < 0)
3752  m_level = 0;
3753  else if (level > 9)
3754  m_level = base::consts::kMaxVerboseLevel;
3755  else
3756  m_level = level;
3757  }
3758 
3759  inline base::type::VerboseLevel level(void) const {
3760  return m_level;
3761  }
3762 
3763  inline void clearModules(void) {
3764  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3765  m_modules.clear();
3766  }
3767 
3768  void setModules(const char* modules) {
3769  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3770  auto addSuffix = [](std::stringstream& ss, const char* sfx, const char* prev) {
3771  if (prev != nullptr && base::utils::Str::endsWith(ss.str(), std::string(prev))) {
3772  std::string chr(ss.str().substr(0, ss.str().size() - strlen(prev)));
3773  ss.str(std::string(""));
3774  ss << chr;
3775  }
3776  if (base::utils::Str::endsWith(ss.str(), std::string(sfx))) {
3777  std::string chr(ss.str().substr(0, ss.str().size() - strlen(sfx)));
3778  ss.str(std::string(""));
3779  ss << chr;
3780  }
3781  ss << sfx;
3782  };
3783  auto insert = [&](std::stringstream& ss, base::type::VerboseLevel level) {
3784  if (!base::utils::hasFlag(LoggingFlag::DisableVModulesExtensions, *m_pFlags)) {
3785  addSuffix(ss, ".h", nullptr);
3786  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3787  addSuffix(ss, ".c", ".h");
3788  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3789  addSuffix(ss, ".cpp", ".c");
3790  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3791  addSuffix(ss, ".cc", ".cpp");
3792  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3793  addSuffix(ss, ".cxx", ".cc");
3794  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3795  addSuffix(ss, ".-inl.h", ".cxx");
3796  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3797  addSuffix(ss, ".hxx", ".-inl.h");
3798  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3799  addSuffix(ss, ".hpp", ".hxx");
3800  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3801  addSuffix(ss, ".hh", ".hpp");
3802  }
3803  m_modules.insert(std::make_pair(ss.str(), level));
3804  };
3805  bool isMod = true;
3806  bool isLevel = false;
3807  std::stringstream ss;
3808  int level = -1;
3809  for (; *modules; ++modules) {
3810  switch (*modules) {
3811  case '=':
3812  isLevel = true;
3813  isMod = false;
3814  break;
3815  case ',':
3816  isLevel = false;
3817  isMod = true;
3818  if (!ss.str().empty() && level != -1) {
3819  insert(ss, level);
3820  ss.str(std::string(""));
3821  level = -1;
3822  }
3823  break;
3824  default:
3825  if (isMod) {
3826  ss << *modules;
3827  } else if (isLevel) {
3828  if (isdigit(*modules)) {
3829  level = static_cast<base::type::VerboseLevel>(*modules) - 48;
3830  }
3831  }
3832  break;
3833  }
3834  }
3835  if (!ss.str().empty() && level != -1) {
3836  insert(ss, level);
3837  }
3838  }
3839 
3840  bool allowed(base::type::VerboseLevel vlevel, const char* file) {
3841  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3842  if (m_modules.empty() || file == nullptr) {
3843  return vlevel <= m_level;
3844  } else {
3845  std::map<std::string, base::type::VerboseLevel>::iterator it = m_modules.begin();
3846  for (; it != m_modules.end(); ++it) {
3847  if (base::utils::Str::wildCardMatch(file, it->first.c_str())) {
3848  return vlevel <= it->second;
3849  }
3850  }
3851  if (base::utils::hasFlag(LoggingFlag::AllowVerboseIfModuleNotSpecified, *m_pFlags)) {
3852  return true;
3853  }
3854  return false;
3855  }
3856  }
3857 
3858  inline const std::map<std::string, base::type::VerboseLevel>& modules(void) const {
3859  return m_modules;
3860  }
3861 
3862  void setFromArgs(const base::utils::CommandLineArgs* commandLineArgs) {
3863  if (commandLineArgs->hasParam("-v") || commandLineArgs->hasParam("--verbose") ||
3864  commandLineArgs->hasParam("-V") || commandLineArgs->hasParam("--VERBOSE")) {
3865  setLevel(base::consts::kMaxVerboseLevel);
3866  } else if (commandLineArgs->hasParamWithValue("--v")) {
3867  setLevel(atoi(commandLineArgs->getParamValue("--v")));
3868  } else if (commandLineArgs->hasParamWithValue("--V")) {
3869  setLevel(atoi(commandLineArgs->getParamValue("--V")));
3870  } else if ((commandLineArgs->hasParamWithValue("-vmodule")) && vModulesEnabled()) {
3871  setModules(commandLineArgs->getParamValue("-vmodule"));
3872  } else if (commandLineArgs->hasParamWithValue("-VMODULE") && vModulesEnabled()) {
3873  setModules(commandLineArgs->getParamValue("-VMODULE"));
3874  }
3875  }
3876 
3878  inline bool vModulesEnabled(void) {
3879  return !base::utils::hasFlag(LoggingFlag::DisableVModules, *m_pFlags);
3880  }
3881 
3882 private:
3883  base::type::VerboseLevel m_level;
3884  base::type::EnumType* m_pFlags;
3885  std::map<std::string, base::type::VerboseLevel> m_modules;
3886 };
3887 } // namespace base
3888 class LogMessage {
3889 public:
3890  LogMessage(Level level, const std::string& file, unsigned long int line, const std::string& func,
3891  base::type::VerboseLevel verboseLevel, Logger* logger) :
3892  m_level(level), m_file(file), m_line(line), m_func(func),
3893  m_verboseLevel(verboseLevel), m_logger(logger), m_message(std::move(logger->stream().str())) {
3894  }
3895  inline Level level(void) const { return m_level; }
3896  inline const std::string& file(void) const { return m_file; }
3897  inline unsigned long int line(void) const { return m_line; } // NOLINT
3898  inline const std::string& func(void) const { return m_func; }
3899  inline base::type::VerboseLevel verboseLevel(void) const { return m_verboseLevel; }
3900  inline Logger* logger(void) const { return m_logger; }
3901  inline const base::type::string_t& message(void) const { return m_message; }
3902 private:
3903  Level m_level;
3904  std::string m_file;
3905  unsigned long int m_line;
3906  std::string m_func;
3907  base::type::VerboseLevel m_verboseLevel;
3908  Logger* m_logger;
3909  base::type::string_t m_message;
3910 };
3911 namespace base {
3912 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3913 class AsyncLogItem {
3914 public:
3915  explicit AsyncLogItem(const LogMessage& logMessage, const LogDispatchData& data, const base::type::string_t& logLine)
3916  : m_logMessage(logMessage), m_dispatchData(data), m_logLine(logLine) {}
3917  virtual ~AsyncLogItem() {}
3918  inline LogMessage* logMessage(void) { return &m_logMessage; }
3919  inline LogDispatchData* data(void) { return &m_dispatchData; }
3920  inline base::type::string_t logLine(void) { return m_logLine; }
3921 private:
3922  LogMessage m_logMessage;
3923  LogDispatchData m_dispatchData;
3924  base::type::string_t m_logLine;
3925 };
3926 class AsyncLogQueue : public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
3927 public:
3928  virtual ~AsyncLogQueue() {
3929  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(6, "~AsyncLogQueue");
3930  }
3931 
3932  inline AsyncLogItem next(void) {
3933  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3934  AsyncLogItem result = m_queue.front();
3935  m_queue.pop();
3936  return result;
3937  }
3938 
3939  inline void push(const AsyncLogItem& item) {
3940  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3941  m_queue.push(item);
3942  }
3943  inline void pop(void) {
3944  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3945  m_queue.pop();
3946  }
3947  inline AsyncLogItem front(void) {
3948  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3949  return m_queue.front();
3950  }
3951  inline bool empty(void) {
3952  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
3953  return m_queue.empty();
3954  }
3955 private:
3956  std::queue<AsyncLogItem> m_queue;
3957 };
3958 class IWorker {
3959 public:
3960  virtual ~IWorker() {}
3961  virtual void start() = 0;
3962 };
3963 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3964 class Storage : base::NoCopy, public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
3966 public:
3967 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3968  Storage(const LogBuilderPtr& defaultLogBuilder, base::IWorker* asyncDispatchWorker) :
3969 #else
3970  explicit Storage(const LogBuilderPtr& defaultLogBuilder) :
3971 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3972  m_registeredHitCounters(new base::RegisteredHitCounters()),
3973  m_registeredLoggers(new base::RegisteredLoggers(defaultLogBuilder)),
3974  m_flags(0x0),
3975  m_vRegistry(new base::VRegistry(0, &m_flags)),
3976 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3977  m_asyncLogQueue(new base::AsyncLogQueue()),
3978  m_asyncDispatchWorker(asyncDispatchWorker),
3979 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3980  m_preRollOutCallback(base::defaultPreRollOutCallback) {
3981  // Register default logger
3982  m_registeredLoggers->get(std::string(base::consts::kDefaultLoggerId));
3983  // Register performance logger and reconfigure format
3984  Logger* performanceLogger = m_registeredLoggers->get(std::string(base::consts::kPerformanceLoggerId));
3985  performanceLogger->configurations()->setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%datetime %level %msg"));
3986  performanceLogger->reconfigure();
3987 #if defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
3988  // Register syslog logger and reconfigure format
3989  Logger* sysLogLogger = m_registeredLoggers->get(std::string(base::consts::kSysLogLoggerId));
3990  sysLogLogger->configurations()->setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Format, std::string("%level: %msg"));
3991  sysLogLogger->reconfigure();
3992 #else
3993  ELPP_UNUSED(base::consts::kSysLogLoggerId);
3994 #endif // defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
3995  addFlag(LoggingFlag::AllowVerboseIfModuleNotSpecified);
3996 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
3997  installLogDispatchCallback<base::AsyncLogDispatchCallback>(std::string("AsyncLogDispatchCallback"));
3998 #else
3999  installLogDispatchCallback<base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback>(std::string("DefaultLogDispatchCallback"));
4000 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4001  installPerformanceTrackingCallback<base::DefaultPerformanceTrackingCallback>(std::string("DefaultPerformanceTrackingCallback"));
4002  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(1, "Easylogging++ has been initialized");
4003 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4004  m_asyncDispatchWorker->start();
4005 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4006  }
4007 
4008  virtual ~Storage(void) {
4009  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(4, "Destroying storage");
4010 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4011  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Replacing log dispatch callback to synchronous");
4012  uninstallLogDispatchCallback<base::AsyncLogDispatchCallback>(std::string("AsyncLogDispatchCallback"));
4013  installLogDispatchCallback<base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback>(std::string("DefaultLogDispatchCallback"));
4014  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Destroying asyncDispatchWorker");
4015  base::utils::safeDelete(m_asyncDispatchWorker);
4016  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Destroying asyncLogQueue");
4017  base::utils::safeDelete(m_asyncLogQueue);
4018 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4019  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Destroying registeredHitCounters");
4020  base::utils::safeDelete(m_registeredHitCounters);
4021  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Destroying registeredLoggers");
4022  base::utils::safeDelete(m_registeredLoggers);
4023  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(5, "Destroying vRegistry");
4024  base::utils::safeDelete(m_vRegistry);
4025  }
4026 
4027  inline bool validateEveryNCounter(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t occasion) {
4028  return hitCounters()->validateEveryN(filename, lineNumber, occasion);
4029  }
4030 
4031  inline bool validateAfterNCounter(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t n) { // NOLINT
4032  return hitCounters()->validateAfterN(filename, lineNumber, n);
4033  }
4034 
4035  inline bool validateNTimesCounter(const char* filename, unsigned long int lineNumber, std::size_t n) { // NOLINT
4036  return hitCounters()->validateNTimes(filename, lineNumber, n);
4037  }
4038 
4039  inline base::RegisteredHitCounters* hitCounters(void) const {
4040  return m_registeredHitCounters;
4041  }
4042 
4043  inline base::RegisteredLoggers* registeredLoggers(void) const {
4044  return m_registeredLoggers;
4045  }
4046 
4047  inline base::VRegistry* vRegistry(void) const {
4048  return m_vRegistry;
4049  }
4050

4052  inline base::AsyncLogQueue* asyncLogQueue(void) const {
4053  return m_asyncLogQueue;
4054  }
4055 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4056 
4057  inline const base::utils::CommandLineArgs* commandLineArgs(void) const {
4058  return &m_commandLineArgs;
4059  }
4060 
4061  inline void addFlag(LoggingFlag flag) {
4062  base::utils::addFlag(flag, &m_flags);
4063  }
4064 
4065  inline void removeFlag(LoggingFlag flag) {
4066  base::utils::removeFlag(flag, &m_flags);
4067  }
4068 
4069  inline bool hasFlag(LoggingFlag flag) const {
4070  return base::utils::hasFlag(flag, m_flags);
4071  }
4072 
4073  inline base::type::EnumType flags(void) const {
4074  return m_flags;
4075  }
4076 
4077  inline void setFlags(base::type::EnumType flags) {
4078  m_flags = flags;
4079  }
4080 
4081  inline void setPreRollOutCallback(const PreRollOutCallback& callback) {
4082  m_preRollOutCallback = callback;
4083  }
4084 
4085  inline void unsetPreRollOutCallback(void) {
4086  m_preRollOutCallback = base::defaultPreRollOutCallback;
4087  }
4088 
4089  inline PreRollOutCallback& preRollOutCallback(void) {
4090  return m_preRollOutCallback;
4091  }
4092 
4093  inline bool hasCustomFormatSpecifier(const char* formatSpecifier) {
4094  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
4095  return std::find(m_customFormatSpecifiers.begin(), m_customFormatSpecifiers.end(),
4096  formatSpecifier) != m_customFormatSpecifiers.end();
4097  }
4098 
4099  inline void installCustomFormatSpecifier(const CustomFormatSpecifier& customFormatSpecifier) {
4100  if (hasCustomFormatSpecifier(customFormatSpecifier.formatSpecifier())) {
4101  return;
4102  }
4103  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
4104  m_customFormatSpecifiers.push_back(customFormatSpecifier);
4105  }
4106 
4107  inline bool uninstallCustomFormatSpecifier(const char* formatSpecifier) {
4108  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(lock());
4109  std::vector<CustomFormatSpecifier>::iterator it = std::find(m_customFormatSpecifiers.begin(),
4110  m_customFormatSpecifiers.end(), formatSpecifier);
4111  if (it != m_customFormatSpecifiers.end() && strcmp(formatSpecifier, it->formatSpecifier()) == 0) {
4112  m_customFormatSpecifiers.erase(it);
4113  return true;
4114  }
4115  return false;
4116  }
4117 
4118  const std::vector<CustomFormatSpecifier>* customFormatSpecifiers(void) const {
4119  return &m_customFormatSpecifiers;
4120  }
4121 
4122  inline void setLoggingLevel(Level level) {
4123  m_loggingLevel = level;
4124  }
4125 
4126  template <typename T>
4127  inline bool installLogDispatchCallback(const std::string& id) {
4128  return installCallback<T, base::type::LogDispatchCallbackPtr>(id, &m_logDispatchCallbacks);
4129  }
4130 
4131  template <typename T>
4132  inline void uninstallLogDispatchCallback(const std::string& id) {
4133  uninstallCallback<T, base::type::LogDispatchCallbackPtr>(id, &m_logDispatchCallbacks);
4134  }
4135  template <typename T>
4136  inline T* logDispatchCallback(const std::string& id) {
4137  return callback<T, base::type::LogDispatchCallbackPtr>(id, &m_logDispatchCallbacks);
4138  }
4139 
4140  template <typename T>
4141  inline bool installPerformanceTrackingCallback(const std::string& id) {
4142  return installCallback<T, base::type::PerformanceTrackingCallbackPtr>(id, &m_performanceTrackingCallbacks);
4143  }
4144 
4145  template <typename T>
4146  inline void uninstallPerformanceTrackingCallback(const std::string& id) {
4147  uninstallCallback<T, base::type::PerformanceTrackingCallbackPtr>(id, &m_performanceTrackingCallbacks);
4148  }
4149 
4150  template <typename T>
4151  inline T* performanceTrackingCallback(const std::string& id) {
4152  return callback<T, base::type::PerformanceTrackingCallbackPtr>(id, &m_performanceTrackingCallbacks);
4153  }
4154 private:
4155  base::RegisteredHitCounters* m_registeredHitCounters;
4156  base::RegisteredLoggers* m_registeredLoggers;
4157  base::type::EnumType m_flags;
4158  base::VRegistry* m_vRegistry;
4159 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4160  base::AsyncLogQueue* m_asyncLogQueue;
4161  base::IWorker* m_asyncDispatchWorker;
4162 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4163  base::utils::CommandLineArgs m_commandLineArgs;
4164  PreRollOutCallback m_preRollOutCallback;
4165  std::map<std::string, base::type::LogDispatchCallbackPtr> m_logDispatchCallbacks;
4166  std::map<std::string, base::type::PerformanceTrackingCallbackPtr> m_performanceTrackingCallbacks;
4167  std::vector<CustomFormatSpecifier> m_customFormatSpecifiers;
4168  Level m_loggingLevel;
4169 
4170  friend class el::Helpers;
4171  friend class el::base::DefaultLogDispatchCallback;
4172  friend class el::LogBuilder;
4173  friend class el::base::MessageBuilder;
4174  friend class el::base::Writer;
4175  friend class el::base::PerformanceTracker;
4176  friend class el::base::LogDispatcher;
4177 
4178  void setApplicationArguments(int argc, char** argv) {
4179  m_commandLineArgs.setArgs(argc, argv);
4180  m_vRegistry->setFromArgs(commandLineArgs());
4181  // default log file
4182 #if !defined(ELPP_DISABLE_LOG_FILE_FROM_ARG)
4183  if (m_commandLineArgs.hasParamWithValue(base::consts::kDefaultLogFileParam)) {
4184  Configurations c;
4185  c.setGlobally(ConfigurationType::Filename, std::string(m_commandLineArgs.getParamValue(base::consts::kDefaultLogFileParam)));
4186  registeredLoggers()->setDefaultConfigurations(c);
4187  for (base::RegisteredLoggers::iterator it = registeredLoggers()->begin();
4188  it != registeredLoggers()->end(); ++it) {
4189  it->second->configure(c);
4190  }
4191  }
4192 #endif // !defined(ELPP_DISABLE_LOG_FILE_FROM_ARG)
4193 #if defined(ELPP_LOGGING_FLAGS_FROM_ARG)
4194  if (m_commandLineArgs.hasParamWithValue(base::consts::kLoggingFlagsParam)) {
4195  m_flags = atoi(m_commandLineArgs.getParamValue(base::consts::kLoggingFlagsParam));
4196  }
4197 #endif // defined(ELPP_LOGGING_FLAGS_FROM_ARG)
4198  }
4199 
4200  inline void setApplicationArguments(int argc, const char** argv) {
4201  setApplicationArguments(argc, const_cast<char**>(argv));
4202  }
4203 
4204  template <typename T, typename TPtr>
4205  inline bool installCallback(const std::string& id, std::map<std::string, TPtr>* mapT) {
4206  if (mapT->find(id) == mapT->end()) {
4207  mapT->insert(std::make_pair(id, TPtr(new T())));
4208  return true;
4209  }
4210  return false;
4211  }
4212 
4213  template <typename T, typename TPtr>
4214  inline void uninstallCallback(const std::string& id, std::map<std::string, TPtr>* mapT) {
4215  if (mapT->find(id) != mapT->end()) {
4216  mapT->erase(id);
4217  }
4218  }
4219 
4220  template <typename T, typename TPtr>
4221  inline T* callback(const std::string& id, std::map<std::string, TPtr>* mapT) {
4222  typename std::map<std::string, TPtr>::iterator iter = mapT->find(id);
4223  if (iter != mapT->end()) {
4224  return static_cast<T*>(iter->second.get());
4225  }
4226  return nullptr;
4227  }
4228 };
4229 extern ELPP_EXPORT base::type::StoragePointer elStorage;
4230 #define ELPP el::base::elStorage
4231 class DefaultLogDispatchCallback : public LogDispatchCallback {
4232 protected:
4233  void handle(const LogDispatchData* data) {
4234  m_data = data;
4235  dispatch(std::move(m_data->logMessage()->logger()->logBuilder()->build(m_data->logMessage(),
4236  m_data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::NormalLog)));
4237  }
4238 private:
4239  const LogDispatchData* m_data;
4240  void dispatch(base::type::string_t&& logLine) {
4241  if (m_data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::NormalLog) {
4242  if (m_data->logMessage()->logger()->m_typedConfigurations->toFile(m_data->logMessage()->level())) {
4243  base::type::fstream_t* fs = m_data->logMessage()->logger()->m_typedConfigurations->fileStream(m_data->logMessage()->level());
4244  if (fs != nullptr) {
4245  fs->write(logLine.c_str(), logLine.size());
4246  if (fs->fail()) {
4247  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unable to write log to file ["
4248  << m_data->logMessage()->logger()->m_typedConfigurations->filename(m_data->logMessage()->level()) << "].\n"
4249  << "Few possible reasons (could be something else):\n" << " * Permission denied\n"
4250  << " * Disk full\n" << " * Disk is not writable", true);
4251  } else {
4252  if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::ImmediateFlush) || (m_data->logMessage()->logger()->isFlushNeeded(m_data->logMessage()->level()))) {
4253  m_data->logMessage()->logger()->flush(m_data->logMessage()->level(), fs);
4254  }
4255  }
4256  } else {
4257  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Log file for [" << LevelHelper::convertToString(m_data->logMessage()->level()) << "] "
4258  << "has not been configured but [TO_FILE] is configured to TRUE. [Logger ID: "
4259  << m_data->logMessage()->logger()->id() << "]", false);
4260  }
4261  }
4262  if (m_data->logMessage()->logger()->m_typedConfigurations->toStandardOutput(m_data->logMessage()->level())) {
4263  if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::ColoredTerminalOutput))
4264  m_data->logMessage()->logger()->logBuilder()->convertToColoredOutput(&logLine, m_data->logMessage()->level());
4265  ELPP_COUT << ELPP_COUT_LINE(logLine);
4266  }
4267  }
4268 #if defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
4269  else if (m_data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::SysLog) {
4270  // Determine syslog priority
4271  int sysLogPriority = 0;
4272  if (m_data->logMessage()->level() == Level::Fatal)
4273  sysLogPriority = LOG_EMERG;
4274  else if (m_data->logMessage()->level() == Level::Error)
4275  sysLogPriority = LOG_ERR;
4276  else if (m_data->logMessage()->level() == Level::Warning)
4277  sysLogPriority = LOG_WARNING;
4278  else if (m_data->logMessage()->level() == Level::Info)
4279  sysLogPriority = LOG_INFO;
4280  else if (m_data->logMessage()->level() == Level::Debug)
4281  sysLogPriority = LOG_DEBUG;
4282  else
4283  sysLogPriority = LOG_NOTICE;
4284 # if defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
4285  char* line = base::utils::Str::wcharPtrToCharPtr(logLine.c_str());
4286  syslog(sysLogPriority, "%s", line);
4287  free(line);
4288 # else
4289  syslog(sysLogPriority, "%s", logLine.c_str());
4290 # endif
4291  }
4292 #endif // defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
4293  }
4294 };
4295 #if ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4296 class AsyncLogDispatchCallback : public LogDispatchCallback {
4297 protected:
4298  void handle(const LogDispatchData* data) {
4299  base::type::string_t logLine = data->logMessage()->logger()->logBuilder()->build(data->logMessage(), data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::NormalLog);
4300  if (data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::NormalLog && data->logMessage()->logger()->typedConfigurations()->toStandardOutput(data->logMessage()->level())) {
4301  if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::ColoredTerminalOutput))
4302  data->logMessage()->logger()->logBuilder()->convertToColoredOutput(&logLine, data->logMessage()->level());
4303  ELPP_COUT << ELPP_COUT_LINE(logLine);
4304  }
4305  // Save resources and only queue if we want to write to file otherwise just ignore handler
4306  if (data->logMessage()->logger()->typedConfigurations()->toFile(data->logMessage()->level())) {
4307  ELPP->asyncLogQueue()->push(AsyncLogItem(*(data->logMessage()), *data, logLine));
4308  }
4309  }
4310 };
4311 class AsyncDispatchWorker : public base::IWorker, public base::threading::ThreadSafe {
4312 public:
4313  AsyncDispatchWorker() {
4314  setContinueRunning(false);
4315  }
4316 
4317  virtual ~AsyncDispatchWorker() {
4318  setContinueRunning(false);
4319  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(6, "Stopping dispatch worker - Cleaning log queue");
4320  clean();
4321  ELPP_INTERNAL_INFO(6, "Log queue cleaned");
4322  }
4323 
4324  inline bool clean() {
4325  std::mutex m;
4326  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lk(m);
4327  cv.wait(lk, []{ return !ELPP->asyncLogQueue()->empty(); });
4328  emptyQueue();
4329  lk.unlock();
4330  cv.notify_one();
4331  return ELPP->asyncLogQueue()->empty();
4332  }
4333 
4334  inline void emptyQueue() {
4335  while (!ELPP->asyncLogQueue()->empty()) {
4336  AsyncLogItem data = ELPP->asyncLogQueue()->next();
4337  handle(&data);
4338  base::threading::msleep(100);
4339  }
4340  }
4341 
4342  virtual inline void start() {
4343  base::threading::msleep(5000); // Wait extra few seconds
4344  setContinueRunning(true);
4345  std::thread t1(&AsyncDispatchWorker::runner, this);
4346  t1.join();
4347  }
4348 
4349  void handle(AsyncLogItem* logItem) {
4350  LogDispatchData* data = logItem->data();
4351  LogMessage* logMessage = logItem->logMessage();
4352  Logger* logger = logMessage->logger();
4353  base::TypedConfigurations* conf = logger->typedConfigurations();
4354  base::type::string_t logLine = logItem->logLine();
4355  if (data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::NormalLog) {
4356  if (conf->toFile(logMessage->level())) {
4357  base::type::fstream_t* fs = conf->fileStream(logMessage->level());
4358  if (fs != nullptr) {
4359  fs->write(logLine.c_str(), logLine.size());
4360  if (fs->fail()) {
4361  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Unable to write log to file ["
4362  << conf->filename(logMessage->level()) << "].\n"
4363  << "Few possible reasons (could be something else):\n" << " * Permission denied\n"
4364  << " * Disk full\n" << " * Disk is not writable", true);
4365  } else {
4366  if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::ImmediateFlush) || (logger->isFlushNeeded(logMessage->level()))) {
4367  logger->flush(logMessage->level(), fs);
4368  }
4369  }
4370  } else {
4371  ELPP_INTERNAL_ERROR("Log file for [" << LevelHelper::convertToString(logMessage->level()) << "] "
4372  << "has not been configured but [TO_FILE] is configured to TRUE. [Logger ID: " << logger->id() << "]", false);
4373  }
4374  }
4375  }
4376 # if defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
4377  else if (data->dispatchAction() == base::DispatchAction::SysLog) {
4378  // Determine syslog priority
4379  int sysLogPriority = 0;
4380  if (logMessage->level() == Level::Fatal)
4381  sysLogPriority = LOG_EMERG;
4382  else if (logMessage->level() == Level::Error)
4383  sysLogPriority = LOG_ERR;
4384  else if (logMessage->level() == Level::Warning)
4385  sysLogPriority = LOG_WARNING;
4386  else if (logMessage->level() == Level::Info)
4387  sysLogPriority = LOG_INFO;
4388  else if (logMessage->level() == Level::Debug)
4389  sysLogPriority = LOG_DEBUG;
4390  else
4391  sysLogPriority = LOG_NOTICE;
4392 # if defined(ELPP_UNICODE)
4393  char* line = base::utils::Str::wcharPtrToCharPtr(logLine.c_str());
4394  syslog(sysLogPriority, "%s", line);
4395  free(line);
4396 # else
4397  syslog(sysLogPriority, "%s", logLine.c_str());
4398 # endif
4399  }
4400 # endif // defined(ELPP_SYSLOG)
4401  }
4402 
4403  void run() {
4404  while (continueRunning()) {
4405  emptyQueue();
4406  base::threading::msleep(10); // 10ms
4407  }
4408  }
4409 
4410  static void* runner(void *context) {
4411  static_cast<AsyncDispatchWorker*>(context)->run();
4412  return NULL;
4413  }
4414 
4415  void setContinueRunning(bool value) {
4416  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(m_continueRunningMutex);
4417  m_continueRunning = value;
4418  }
4419  bool continueRunning(void) {
4420  return m_continueRunning;
4421  }
4422 private:
4423  std::condition_variable cv;
4424  bool m_continueRunning;
4425  base::threading::Mutex m_continueRunningMutex;
4426 };
4427 #endif // ELPP_ASYNC_LOGGING
4428 } // namespace base
4429 namespace base {
4430 class DefaultLogBuilder : public LogBuilder {
4431 public:
4432  base::type::string_t build(const LogMessage* logMessage, bool appendNewLine) const {
4433  base::TypedConfigurations* tc = logMessage->logger()->typedConfigurations();
4434  const base::LogFormat* logFormat = &tc->logFormat(logMessage->level());
4435  base::type::string_t logLine = logFormat->format();
4436  char buff[base::consts::kSourceFilenameMaxLength + base::consts::kSourceLineMaxLength] = "";
4437  const char* bufLim = buff + sizeof(buff);
4438  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::AppName)) {
4439  // App name
4440  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kAppNameFormatSpecifier,
4441  logMessage->logger()->parentApplicationName());
4442  }
4443  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::ThreadId)) {
4444  // Thread ID
4445  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kThreadIdFormatSpecifier,
4446  base::threading::getCurrentThreadId());
4447  }
4448  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::DateTime)) {
4449  // DateTime
4450  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kDateTimeFormatSpecifier,
4451  base::utils::DateTime::getDateTime(logFormat->dateTimeFormat().c_str(),
4452  &tc->millisecondsWidth(logMessage->level())));
4453  }
4454  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::Function)) {
4455  // Function
4456  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kLogFunctionFormatSpecifier, logMessage->func());
4457  }
4458  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::File)) {
4459  // File
4460  char* buf = base::utils::Str::clearBuff(buff, base::consts::kSourceFilenameMaxLength);
4461  base::utils::File::buildStrippedFilename(logMessage->file().c_str(), buff);
4462  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff(buff, buf, bufLim);
4463  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kLogFileFormatSpecifier, std::string(buff));
4464  }
4465  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::FileBase)) {
4466  // FileBase
4467  char* buf = base::utils::Str::clearBuff(buff, base::consts::kSourceFilenameMaxLength);
4468  base::utils::File::buildBaseFilename(logMessage->file(), buff);
4469  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff(buff, buf, bufLim);
4470  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kLogFileBaseFormatSpecifier, std::string(buff));
4471  }
4472  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::Line)) {
4473  // Line
4474  char* buf = base::utils::Str::clearBuff(buff, base::consts::kSourceLineMaxLength);
4475  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(logMessage->line(),
4476  base::consts::kSourceLineMaxLength, buf, bufLim, false);
4477  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kLogLineFormatSpecifier, std::string(buff));
4478  }
4479  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::Location)) {
4480  // Location
4481  char* buf = base::utils::Str::clearBuff(buff,
4482  base::consts::kSourceFilenameMaxLength + base::consts::kSourceLineMaxLength);
4483  base::utils::File::buildStrippedFilename(logMessage->file().c_str(), buff);
4484  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff(buff, buf, bufLim);
4485  buf = base::utils::Str::addToBuff(":", buf, bufLim);
4486  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(logMessage->line(),
4487  base::consts::kSourceLineMaxLength, buf, bufLim, false);
4488  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kLogLocationFormatSpecifier, std::string(buff));
4489  }
4490  if (logMessage->level() == Level::Verbose && logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::VerboseLevel)) {
4491  // Verbose level
4492  char* buf = base::utils::Str::clearBuff(buff, 1);
4493  buf = base::utils::Str::convertAndAddToBuff(logMessage->verboseLevel(), 1, buf, bufLim, false);
4494  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kVerboseLevelFormatSpecifier, std::string(buff));
4495  }
4496  if (logFormat->hasFlag(base::FormatFlags::LogMessage)) {
4497  // Log message
4498  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, base::consts::kMessageFormatSpecifier, logMessage->message());
4499  }
4500 #if !defined(ELPP_DISABLE_CUSTOM_FORMAT_SPECIFIERS)
4501  for (std::vector<CustomFormatSpecifier>::const_iterator it = ELPP->customFormatSpecifiers()->begin();
4502  it != ELPP->customFormatSpecifiers()->end(); ++it) {
4503  std::string fs(it->formatSpecifier());
4504  base::type::string_t wcsFormatSpecifier(fs.begin(), fs.end());
4505  base::utils::Str::replaceFirstWithEscape(logLine, wcsFormatSpecifier, std::string(it->resolver()()));
4506  }
4507 #endif // !defined(ELPP_DISABLE_CUSTOM_FORMAT_SPECIFIERS)
4508  if (appendNewLine) logLine += ELPP_LITERAL("\n");
4509  return logLine;
4510  }
4511 };
4513 class LogDispatcher : base::NoCopy {
4514 public:
4515  LogDispatcher(bool proceed, LogMessage&& logMessage, base::DispatchAction dispatchAction) :
4516  m_proceed(proceed),
4517  m_logMessage(std::move(logMessage)),
4518  m_dispatchAction(std::move(dispatchAction)) {
4519  }
4520 
4521  void dispatch(void) {
4522  if (m_proceed && m_dispatchAction == base::DispatchAction::None) {
4523  m_proceed = false;
4524  }
4525  if (!m_proceed) {
4526  return;
4527  }
4528  // We minimize the time of ELPP's lock - this lock is released after log is written
4529  base::threading::ScopedLock scopedLock(ELPP->lock());
4530  base::TypedConfigurations* tc = m_logMessage.logger()->m_typedConfigurations;
4531  if (ELPP->hasFlag(LoggingFlag::StrictLogFileSizeCheck)) {
4532  tc->validateFileRolling(m_logMessage.level(), ELPP->preRollOutCallback());
4533  }
4534  LogDispatchCallback* callback = nullptr;
4535  LogDispatchData data;
4536  for (const std::pair<std::string, base::type::LogDispatchCallbackPtr>& h
4537  : ELPP->m_logDispatchCallbacks) {
4538  callback = h.second.get();
4539  if (callback != nullptr && callback->enabled()) {
4540  data.setLogMessage(&m_logMessage);
4541  data.setDispatchAction(m_dispatchAction);
4542  callback->acquireLock();
4543  callback->handle(&data);
4544  callback->releaseLock();
4545  }
4546  }
4547  }
4548 
4549 private:
4550  bool m_proceed;
4551  LogMessage m_logMessage;
4552  base::DispatchAction m_dispatchAction;
4553 };
4554 #if defined(ELPP_STL_LOGGING)
4555 namespace workarounds {
4563 template <typename T, typename Container>
4564 class IterableContainer {
4565 public:
4566  typedef typename Container::iterator iterator;
4567  typedef typename Container::const_iterator const_iterator;
4568  IterableContainer(void) {}
4569  virtual ~IterableContainer(void) {}
4570  iterator begin(void) { return getContainer().begin(); }
4571  iterator end(void) { return getContainer().end(); }
4572 private:
4573  virtual Container& getContainer(void) = 0;
4574 };
4576 template<typename T, typename Container = std::vector<T>, typename Comparator = std::less<typename Container::value_type>>
4577 class IterablePriorityQueue : public IterableContainer<T, Container>, public std::priority_queue<T, Container, Comparator> {
4578 public:
4579  IterablePriorityQueue(std::priority_queue<T, Container, Comparator> queue_) {
4580  std::size_t count_ = 0;
